def bfs(q, adj, labels1, labels2):
    ql = 0
    vis = set()
    for t in q:
        vis.add(t)
    while ql < len(q):
        x = q[ql]
        ql += 1
        for y in adj[x]:
            if y not in vis:
                vis.add(y)
                q.append(y)
    # print(q)
    for t in q:
        if labels1[t] or labels2[t]:
            return False
    return True


class Solution:
    def canReachCorner(self, X: int, Y: int, circles: List[List[int]]) -> bool:
        n = len(circles)
        is_left = [False for _ in range(n)]
        is_right = [False for _ in range(n)]
        is_down = [False for _ in range(n)]
        is_up = [False for _ in range(n)]
        q_left = []
        q_right = []
        q_down = []
        q_up = []
        for i in range(n):
            x, y, r = circles[i]
            if x - r <= 0:
                q_left.append(i)
                is_left[i] = True
            if x + r >= X:
                q_right.append(i)
                is_right[i] = True
            if y - r <= 0:
                q_down.append(i)
                is_down[i] = True
            if y + r >= Y:
                q_up.append(i)
                is_up[i] = True
        
        adj = [[] for _ in range(n)]
        for i in range(n):
            x1, y1, r1 = circles[i]
            for j in range(i + 1, n):
                x2, y2, r2 = circles[j]
                dist_ = (x1 - x2) ** 2 + (y1 - y2) ** 2
                r_ = (r1 + r2) ** 2
                if dist_ <= r_:
                    adj[i].append(j)
                    adj[j].append(i)
        
        # print(q_left)
        # print(q_right)
        # print(is_left)
        # print(is_right)
        # print(is_down)
        # print(is_up)
        # print(adj)
        ans1 = bfs(q_left, adj, is_down, is_right)
        ans2 = bfs(q_up, adj, is_right, is_down)
        return ans1 and ans2
